intro: Urostachys socratis, commonly known as the Socratis' rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in the spring. Urostachys socratis thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
